page.title: 04The Canal at Deepcut, 1985
page.content: To date about 40km of the {Basingstoke Canal}have been dredged. For the first time in 30 years a boat has passed through 9 of the 14 locks forming the{Deepcut Flight.}The canal is no longer used for trade purposes but is purely for recreation. The aim of the restoration, according to the chairman of the Surrey and Hampshire Canal Society, is "to give pleasure to many and to enhance the areas through which it passes". Large development areas proposed along the canal banks have caused concern to the Canal Society who feel that the amenity value will be destroyed. Residents have written to a local newspaper giving their views on the restoration work. They feel that the work leaves a trail of destruction. Many people feel that the canal should be kept as a place of peace and quiet.
